resources.string: I accept that the information entered will be used to manage my account and notify me of any changes in the status of my reports, in accordance with our privacy policy.
I accept to receive updates to my reports by email.
Hello, how can we help you ?
Simple and practical, ScanMed is the best solution for reporting a shortage of medications in pharmacies near you.
Please click on any of the titles to be redirected
● Click on the “+” button at the bottom of the home page.
● Choose a method to identify the medication in short supply :
● Document : Directly download the DataMatrix present on a PDF document.
● Scan : Scan the DataMatrix on the medication box using the camera.
● CIP : Enter the CIP code found on the medication box.
● Select the pharmacy where the medication is in short supply.
● Check the description of the medication and the selected pharmacy one last time.
● Click on the “History” button at the bottom of the home page.
● View the processing status of your reports in real time.
Different statuses can be given to a report :
● “Canceled” : Your report has not been confirmed by the administrator.
● “In restocking”: The restocking process for the medication you reported is in progress.
● “Restocked”: The medication you reported is now available in the pharmacy !
● Click on the “Settings” button in the middle of the home page.
● Click on the “?” button in the middle of the home page.
● Find an item that meets your needs.
● If you do not find a satisfactory answer there, you can contact the ScanMed administrator by clicking on “Contact Support”.
● “Verification”: Your report is being verified by the ScanMed administrator.
Saisissez l’adresse email rattachée à votre compte afin que nous puissions vous transmettre les instructions pour réinitialiser votre mot de passe.
Vous vous souvenez de votre mot de passe ?
Créer un nouveau mot de passe
Créer un nouveau mot de passer pour vous connecter et accéder à ScanMed.
Votre mot de passe doit avoir au moins 8 caractères et doit contenir des lettres minuscules, des lettres majuscules, des chiffres et des caractères spéciaux (!$@%).
Les mots de passe doivent correspondre.
Le nouveau mot de passe et la confirmation du mot de passe doivent correspondre.
Votre mot de passe a été changé avec succès !
Assurez-vous de suivre toutes les instructions lors de la création de votre nouveau mot de passe.
Saisissez le mot de passe que vous utilisez actuellement pour vous connecter.
Votre mot de passe a été modifié avec succès !
Vous pouvez modifier votre nom d\'utilisateur, votre email et votre mot de passe.

These T&Cs or General Conditions of Use legally govern the use of the services of the ScanMed mobile app (hereinafter referred to as “the app”). Constituting the contract between the company ScanMed and the User, access to the app must be preceded by acceptance of these T&Cs. Access to this platform signifies acceptance of these T&Cs.

For the creation of the User\'s account, the collection of information at the time of registration on the app is necessary and obligatory. In accordance with Law No. 78-17 of January 6 relating to information technology, files and freedoms, the collection and processing of personal information is carried out with respect for privacy.
The CIP code or Presentation Identifier Code is a 7 or 13-digit numerical code which allows a presentation (or packaging) of a medicine to be identified.
Where to find a CIP code ?
Your report has been sent to the ScanMed administrator!
